back.title: because
back.description: Conjunction used to express cause or reason.

back.title: therefore, so
back.description: Conjunction indicating result or conclusion.

back.title: if
back.description: Conditional conjunction for hypothetical situations.

back.title: although
back.description: Conjunction expressing contrast or concession.

back.title: but, however
back.description: Adversative conjunction showing contrast.

back.title: or, still
back.description: Used in questions offering alternatives or expressing preference.

back.title: according to
back.description: Preposition indicating basis or foundation.

back.title: regarding, as for
back.description: Preposition introducing a topic or subject.

back.title: about, concerning
back.description: Preposition introducing a topic or subject matter.

back.title: in order to, for
back.description: Preposition expressing purpose or goal.

back.title: except, besides
back.description: Preposition indicating exclusion or addition.

back.title: for example
back.description: Phrase used to introduce examples.

back.title: especially, special
back.description: Adverb/adjective indicating emphasis or uniqueness.

back.title: generally, ordinary
back.description: Adverb/adjective indicating typical or average.

back.title: usually, normally
back.description: Adverb indicating habitual or typical behavior.

back.title: often, frequently
back.description: Adverb indicating high frequency.

back.title: occasionally
back.description: Adverb indicating infrequent occurrence.

back.title: intelligent, smart
back.description: Adjective describing mental ability.

back.title: hardworking, effort
back.description: Adjective/noun describing diligence or trying hard.

back.title: body and mind
back.description: Noun referring to physical and mental well-being.

back.title: healthy, health
back.description: Adjective/noun relating to physical wellness.

back.title: safe, safety
back.description: Adjective/noun relating to security and protection.

back.title: dangerous, danger
back.description: Adjective/noun indicating risk or hazard.

back.title: convenient
back.description: Adjective describing ease of use or accessibility.

back.title: difficult, difficulty
back.description: Adjective/noun indicating challenge or hardship.

back.title: easy
back.description: Adjective indicating simplicity or lack of difficulty.

back.title: complicated, complex
back.description: Adjective describing intricacy or complexity.

back.title: simple
back.description: Adjective indicating straightforwardness or ease.

back.title: important
back.description: Adjective indicating significance or priority.

back.title: interesting, fun
back.description: Adjective describing something engaging or entertaining.

back.title: boring
back.description: Adjective describing lack of interest or excitement.

back.title: hope, wish
back.description: Verb/noun expressing desire or expectation.

back.title: worry, concerned
back.description: Verb/adjective expressing anxiety or concern.

back.title: happy, glad
back.description: Adjective expressing joy or pleasure.

back.title: sad, upset
back.description: Adjective expressing sorrow or distress.

back.title: angry
back.description: Adjective expressing anger or irritation.

back.title: surprised
back.description: Adjective expressing astonishment or shock.

back.title: satisfied
back.description: Adjective expressing contentment or approval.

back.title: disappointed
back.description: Adjective expressing letdown or dissatisfaction.

back.title: employment
back.description: Noun relating to having a job or career.

back.title: unemployment
back.description: Noun/adjective relating to being without work.

back.title: profession, career
back.description: Noun referring to one's occupation or job.

back.title: manager
back.description: Noun referring to a person in charge of operations.

back.title: employee, staff
back.description: Noun referring to a worker in an organization.

back.title: company
back.description: Noun referring to a business organization.

back.title: office
back.description: Noun referring to a workplace or room for business.

back.title: meeting, conference
back.description: Noun referring to a formal gathering for discussion.

back.title: project
back.description: Noun referring to a planned undertaking or task.

back.title: plan, planning
back.description: Noun/verb relating to organizing future actions.

back.title: goal, target
back.description: Noun referring to an objective or aim.

back.title: result, outcome
back.description: Noun referring to the consequence or conclusion.

back.title: success, successful
back.description: Noun/adjective relating to achievement or accomplishment.

back.title: failure, fail
back.description: Noun/verb relating to lack of success.

back.title: problem, question
back.description: Noun referring to an issue or inquiry.

back.title: solve, resolve
back.description: Verb meaning to find a solution to a problem.

back.title: improve, increase
back.description: Verb meaning to enhance or raise the level of something.

back.title: develop, development
back.description: Verb/noun relating to growth or progress.

back.title: change, transformation
back.description: Noun/verb relating to alteration or modification.

back.title: progress, improve
back.description: Noun/verb relating to advancement or betterment.

back.title: regress, deteriorate
back.description: Verb/noun indicating decline or moving backward.

back.title: efficiency
back.description: Noun referring to productivity or effectiveness.

back.title: quality
back.description: Noun referring to the standard or grade of something.

back.title: quantity, amount
back.description: Noun referring to the number or volume of something.

back.title: price
back.description: Noun referring to the cost or value of something.

back.title: value, worth
back.description: Noun referring to importance, usefulness, or monetary worth.

back.title: use, utilize
back.description: Verb meaning to make use of or take advantage of.

back.title: waste, squander
back.description: Verb/noun relating to using something carelessly or excessively.

back.title: save, economize
back.description: Verb meaning to use less or conserve resources.

back.title: service, serve
back.description: Noun/verb relating to helping or providing assistance.

back.title: product
back.description: Noun referring to something produced or manufactured.

back.title: market
back.description: Noun referring to a place or system for buying and selling.

back.title: client, customer
back.description: Noun referring to someone who uses services or buys products.

back.title: sales, sell
back.description: Noun/verb relating to the act of selling products or services.

back.title: purchase, buy
back.description: Verb meaning to acquire something by paying for it.

back.title: competition, compete
back.description: Noun/verb relating to rivalry or striving for advantage.

back.title: cooperation, collaborate
back.description: Noun/verb relating to working together toward a common goal.

back.title: achievement, accomplishment
back.description: Noun referring to something successfully completed or attained.

back.title: experience
back.description: Noun referring to knowledge gained through practice or exposure.

back.title: ability, capability
back.description: Noun referring to the power or skill to do something.

back.title: skill
back.description: Noun referring to expertise or proficiency in a particular area.

back.title: knowledge
back.description: Noun referring to information, understanding, or awareness.

back.title: study, learn
back.description: Verb meaning to acquire knowledge or skills through instruction or practice.

back.title: teaching, instruction
back.description: Noun/verb relating to the process of imparting knowledge.

back.title: training
back.description: Noun/verb relating to developing skills through practice and instruction.

back.title: research, study
back.description: Noun/verb relating to systematic investigation or examination.

back.title: discover, find
back.description: Verb meaning to become aware of or locate something previously unknown.

back.title: innovation, innovate
back.description: Noun/verb relating to introducing new ideas or methods.
